Package de.htw.battleship

Class BattleshipGame

java.lang.Object
de.htw.battleship.BattleshipGame
public class BattleshipGame
extends java.lang.Object
An instance of this class holds the state of a running match and the game logic.

  • Field Details

    • playerBoard

      final Board playerBoard

    • villainBoard

      final Board villainBoard

    • villainAI

      final AI villainAI

    • playerName

      final java.lang.String playerName

    • shots

      int shots

    • playerWon

      boolean playerWon

    • running

      boolean running
      Set to TRUE to keep the game loop running. Set to FALSE to exit.

    • hideVillainShips

      private final boolean hideVillainShips
      When playing, enemy ships should be hidden from the player. Change below to FALSE for testing purposes during development of this program.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • BattleshipGame

      public BattleshipGame​(int AILevel, java.lang.String playerName)
      Creates a new game with new boards.
      Parameters:
      AILevel - The chosen AI difficulty level
      playerName - The chosen player name

    • BattleshipGame

      public BattleshipGame​(Board playerBoard, Board villainBoard, int AILevel, java.lang.String playerName, int shots)
      Creates a game based on saved boards from a previous game.
      Parameters:
      playerBoard - The saved player board
      villainBoard - The saved villain board
      AILevel - The saved AI difficulty level
      playerName - The saved name of the player
      shots - The saved amount of shots fired by the player in the saved game

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Main game loop. Keep running to play. Interrupt the loop to get back to main menu.

    • validateInput

      private static boolean validateInput​(java.lang.String input)
      Checks whether the input has the correct format (first char is letter from a-z or A-Z, rest is a number less than 10, string length less than 4)
      Parameters:
      input - The input string that needs to be checked
      Returns:
      Whether the given input has a valid format or not

    • printResult

      private static void printResult​(int result)
      Prints the result of the shot on the console, given the result code
      Parameters:
      result - The result code returned from the Board.shoot method

    • playersTurn

      private void playersTurn()
      Prompts the player to input their shot and executes it. If the player just hits enter they get back to the main menu.

    • villainsTurn

      private void villainsTurn()
      Lets the villain (computer) choose and play their shot.

    • pause

      private void pause()
      Asks the user to press ENTER to continue. Can be called anywhere in the game to avoid too much output at once.

    • getVillainShot

      private Vector2d getVillainShot()
      Gets an array with the two coordinates (x,y) the villain shoots at.
      Returns:
      An array with the two coordinates of the villain's shot.

    • isFinished

      public boolean isFinished()
      Checks if game is finished
      Returns:
      Whether game ist finished or not.

    • convertCoordinatesToInt

      public static Vector2d convertCoordinatesToInt​(java.lang.String input)
      Converts alphanumeric board coordinates to array indexes, e.g. A1 to [0,0]
      Parameters:
      input - The input string that needs to be converted
      Returns:
      An array containing the coordinates from the input string.

    • convertCoordinatesToString

      public static java.lang.String convertCoordinatesToString​(Vector2d input)
      Converts a Vector2d to ahlphanumeric board coordinates, e.g. [0,0] to A1
      Parameters:
      input - input coordinates that need to be converted
      Returns:
      String coordinates made from the numeric board coordinates.

    • setAILevel

      public void setAILevel​(int AILevel)
      Wrapper for the setter of the difficulty level of the AI
      Parameters:
      AILevel - The desired difficulty level for the AI

    • getAILevel

      public int getAILevel()
      Wrapper for the getter of the difficulty level of the AI
      Returns:
      The difficulty level of the AI

    • getPlayerName

      public java.lang.String getPlayerName()
      Getter of the attribute playerName
      Returns:
      The name of the player currently playing

    • getShots

      public int getShots()
      Getter of the attribute shots
      Returns:
      The shots that have been fired by the player in the current match
